# Report Generation Instructions

These instructions guide the `report-visualizer` agent when building the HTML dashboard.

## HTML Standards

- Valid HTML5 with `<!DOCTYPE html>` declaration.
- Character encoding: `<meta charset="UTF-8">`.
- Viewport meta tag for responsiveness: `<meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">`.
- Self-contained: all CSS must be inline (in a `<style>` block in `<head>`). No external CDN links, no JavaScript.

## Visual Design

- **Color palette**: Clean and academic. Use white background (`#ffffff`), dark text (`#1a1a1a`), a blue-grey header (`#2c3e50`), and a light accent (`#3498db`) for links and score badges.
- **Typography**: System font stack — `font-family: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, "Segoe UI", Roboto, sans-serif`.
- **Table**: Alternating row colors (`#f9f9f9` / `#ffffff`); a visible header row with `#2c3e50` background and white text; `border-collapse: collapse`; `1px solid #ddd` cell borders.
- **Relevance score badge**: Display the score as a small rounded badge. Color it green (`#27ae60`) for 8–10, orange (`#f39c12`) for 5–7, grey (`#95a5a6`) for 0–4.

## Required Sections (in order)

1. **`<header>`**: Title "Q-Bio Watchtower" + subtitle "Daily arXiv q-bio.QM Digest — {YYYY-MM-DD UTC}" + paper count
2. **`<main>`**:
   - Ranked paper table with columns: Rank | Title (PDF link) | Authors | Date | TL;DR | Keywords | Score
   - Narrative summary `<section>` (2–3 sentences on the day's key themes)
3. **`<footer>`**: "Generated by Q-Bio Watchtower · Data source: arXiv q-bio.QM · {timestamp}"

## Content Rules

- Title cell: paper title is a hyperlink to `pdf_link`, opens in `target="_blank"`.
- Authors: show first 3 authors; if more, append "et al."
- Keywords: render as comma-separated inline text, not as tags or badges.
- If zero papers: replace the table with a centered message: "No new q-bio.QM papers in the last 24 hours."
